articles.headline: Inflation Cooled in July, Welcome News for White House and Fed
articles.snippet: Prices have increased rapidly since last year, but barely budged in July — a positive development, though not yet enough for a victory lap.
articles.abstract: Prices have increased rapidly since last year, but barely budged in July — a positive development, though not yet enough for a victory lap.
articles.lead_paragraph: Inflation cooled notably in July as gas prices and airfares fell, a welcome reprieve for consumers and a positive development for economic policymakers in Washington — though not yet a conclusive sign that price increases have turned a corner.
articles.byline: By Jeanna Smialek and Ana Swanson

articles.headline: The Boy Bosses of Silicon Valley Are on Their Way Out
articles.snippet: They rode their unicorns to fame and fortune. In a rocky market, it got a little less fun.
articles.abstract: They rode their unicorns to fame and fortune. In a rocky market, it got a little less fun.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — The young kings of Silicon Valley are dismounting their unicorns.

articles.headline: Disney Profit Jumps 50%, and Streaming Subscriptions Surpass Netflix
articles.snippet: The company unveiled details of an ad-supported Disney+ as demand at its theme parks rebounded.
articles.abstract: The company unveiled details of an ad-supported Disney+ as demand at its theme parks rebounded.
articles.lead_paragraph: LOS ANGELES — Bucking a streaming slowdown that has recently bedeviled Hollywood, Disney+ added 14.4 million subscribers in the most recent quarter, about 45 percent more than Wall Street had expected and lifting Disney’s portfolio of streaming services to 221 million subscribers worldwide, edging ahead of Netflix for the first time.

articles.headline: Contradicting Kremlin’s Account, Crimean Officials Detail Explosions’ Extent
articles.snippet: Blasts at an air base in the Russian-occupied territory damaged 62 apartment buildings and forced hundreds into shelters. Satellite imagery showed destroyed fighter jets.
articles.abstract: Blasts at an air base in the Russian-occupied territory damaged 62 apartment buildings and forced hundreds into shelters. Satellite imagery showed destroyed fighter jets.
articles.lead_paragraph: ODESA, Ukraine — After explosions tore through a Russian air base in Crimea on Tuesday, Russia’s Defense Ministry quickly played down the extent of the damage, saying a munitions blast had left no casualties and that no equipment had been destroyed.
articles.byline: By Michael Schwirtz, Alan Yuhas and Christiaan Triebert

articles.headline: Trump Claims He’s a Victim of Tactics He Once Deployed
articles.snippet: Donald J. Trump’s efforts to politicize the law enforcement system have now become his shield as he tries to deflect accusations of wrongdoing.
articles.abstract: Donald J. Trump’s efforts to politicize the law enforcement system have now become his shield as he tries to deflect accusations of wrongdoing.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Two days after the 2020 election that Donald J. Trump refused to admit he lost, his oldest son, Donald Trump Jr., made an urgent recommendation: “Fire Wray.”

articles.headline: Gas Prices in the U.S. Fall Below $4 a Gallon
articles.snippet: After peaking in June, they are back where they were in March, offering some relief to consumers and policymakers amid inflation worries.
articles.abstract: After peaking in June, they are back where they were in March, offering some relief to consumers and policymakers amid inflation worries.
articles.lead_paragraph: Gas prices in the United States fell below $4 a gallon on Thursday, retreating to their lowest level since March, a sign of relief for Americans struggling with historically high inflation and a political boost for President Biden, who has been under pressure to do more to bring down prices.

articles.headline: The Tricky Math of Retiring Into a Downturn
articles.snippet: Market declines during the first five years of retirement can have a significant effect on a financial portfolio, but remaining flexible can mitigate the damage.
articles.abstract: Market declines during the first five years of retirement can have a significant effect on a financial portfolio, but remaining flexible can mitigate the damage.
articles.lead_paragraph: Most Americans finance their retirement with a certain amount of faith: Investing will help their savings keep pace with inflation, institutions will continue to work as they always have, it will all work out in the end.

articles.headline: How New Zealand’s Climate Fight Is Threatening Its Iconic Farmland
articles.snippet: As the country puts a growing price on greenhouse emissions, investors are rushing to buy up pastures and plant carbon-sucking trees.
articles.abstract: As the country puts a growing price on greenhouse emissions, investors are rushing to buy up pastures and plant carbon-sucking trees.
articles.lead_paragraph: GISBORNE, New Zealand — Horehore Station, a sheep and cattle ranch, sprawls across 4,000 acres on New Zealand’s North Island, its jagged expanse of uneven hills and steep gullies blanketed in lush green grass.
